statements.name: PROC TEXTCONCEPT
statements.description: The PROC TEXTCONCEPT statement builds a concept model by using LITI rules and, optionally, predefined entities.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the input data table that contains the textual LITI rules.

arguments.name: LANGUAGE=
arguments.description: specifies the language to be used for compiling the language-specific LI binary.

arguments.name: PREDEFINEDNER
arguments.description: determines whether to include the predefined concepts model in the LI binary.

arguments.name: SYNTAXERRORS=
arguments.description: specifies the output table that contains the syntax error information about LITI rules.

arguments.name: TOKENIZER=
arguments.description: specifies which tokenizer to use in the LITI model.

arguments.name: BASIC
arguments.description: applies the basic tokenizer.

arguments.name: STANDARD
arguments.description: applies a language-specific tokenizer. By default, TOKENIZER=STANDARD.

statements.name: ASTORESETTINGS
statements.description: The ASTORESETTINGS statement enables you to further configure the concept analytic store model that you save by using the SAVESTATE statement. This statement is optional.

arguments.name: MATCHTYPE=
arguments.description: determines how to treat overlapping matches while scoring the concept analytic store model. By default, MATCHTYPE=ALL.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: returns all the terms that match any of the concepts.

arguments.name: BEST
arguments.description: returns only the match for the concept that has the highest priority setting.

arguments.name: LONGEST
arguments.description: returns the longest match for the concept.

arguments.name: MAXCHAR=
arguments.description: specifies the length of output character variables while scoring the concept analytic store model. By default, MAXCHAR=1024. The minimum value is 9, and the maximum value is 536870911.

arguments.name: OUTPUTMODE=
arguments.description: specifies which output tables are generated when the concept analytic store model is scored. By default, OUTPUTMODE=DEFAULT.

arguments.name: DATAGRID
arguments.description: specifies that the concept analytic store model creates one output table that contains concept results and fact results. Each document corresponds to one output row of data grids. Use this option if you plan to score the analytic store by using DS2 or by using a SAS Micro Analytic Service or SAS Embedded Process. This option is also compatible with PROC ASTORE.

arguments.name: DEFAULT
arguments.description: specifies that the concept analytic store model creates two output tables from the input table. The two tables contain concept results and fact results.

arguments.name: TEXT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable that contains documents for scoring the model. By default, TEXT="_text_".

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement names the variable in the DATA= table that contains the rule IDs. This statement is required.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the DATA= table that contains the rule IDs.

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: The INPUT statement names the variable in the DATA= table that contains the textual LITI rules. This statement is required.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the DATA= table that contains the textual LITI rules.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement specifies the output table to contain the compiled LI binary. This statement is optional.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies the output table to contain the compiled LI binary.

statements.name: SAVESTATE
statements.description: The SAVESTATE statement specifies the output table to contain a compiled concept analytic store model. This statement is optional.

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: specifies the output table to contain a concept analytic store model.
